title: Firefox 95.0.2 continuos tab crash on Ryzen 7 1700 cpu Window 10 64bit
content:
Hi,

since the yesterday update to 95.0.2 I'm experiencing random tab crashes quite often. Please note, it's only a tab crash, no Firefox crash at all. I'm having crashes inside Gmal or any other site.

Previous version 95.0.1 or 95.0 have no issues at all (no tab crashes). IMHO it could be related to the fix introduced in 95.0.2 related to AMD CPUs (even if Ryzen 7 1700 is not listed).

Hope you can troubleshoot this issue soon. I'm sending reports on each tab crash I have for now.

All the best

Simone
creator: Spulci

title: Importazione password
content:
Buongiorno a tutti, dopo anni il mio vecchio pc mi sta abbandonando e sto cercando di migrare velocemente tutti i dati sul nuovo computer. Ho espoertato tutte le password salvate in firefox, pronto per importarle (come descritto minuziosamente nella guida), ma...pessima sorpresa: la funzionalità importa da file non è presente...

Come fare?

Ho scaricato firefox ieri pertanto immagino sia l'ultima release.

Dove sbaglio?

Grazie mille a tutti e visto il periodo buone feste

title: Firefox ESR version 78.11.0
content:
I need to download Firefox ESR version 78.11.0 in order to access some other software which only works on that Firefox version. However, when I go to https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/switch-to-firefox-extended-support-release-esr#firefox:win10:fx91, open the drown on the right and select the 78-version, click download, it still just downloads the 91-version. What am I doing wrong?? Have tried doing it with Edge and regular Firefox latest version but without success.

/Anders B
creator: anders.brandstrom

title: Fonts broken
content: Hi all, due to the sometimes quite rude tone in the german forum, I dare to ask my question here: Since the last update to FF 95.x a few weeks ago, I have this strange behaviour with some fonts, as e.g. Manrope, Lato and others (mostly from Google). Parts of the types are white (refer to the screenshot). I'm using Mac OS 10.15.17. Is this a known issue - and is there a remedy? Thanks so much, Martin

On opening a new window, I can click and view the menu, but within a few seconds it vanishes, but the button remains highlighted as though it's still open, so I can't re-open it.

title: NO longin box on website I subscribe to
content:
I subscribe to a publication called Nikkei Asia. Their site is asia.nikkei.com.

I get regular e-mails from them with headlines. If I click on these to 'READ MORE' I cannot because the login box doesn't appear.

To access the content of the publication I have to log in, using the login box that appears on the first page of the site. BUT using Firefox, which is my regular, default browser NO login box appears.

If I use another browser (e.g. Safari) the login box appears automatically.

So what's the problem. This is an important news site for me so if I can't solve this, I will probably switch my default browser to Safari.

Any idea what's wrong?
creator: rbmcarthur
